to pay money, usually once a year, to have copies of a newspaper or magazine sent to you, or to have some other service
You can subscribe to the magazine for as little as $32 a year.
to pay money regularly to be a member of an organization or to help its work
She subscribes to an environmental action group.
to agree to buy or pay for shares
Each employee may subscribe for up to Â£2,000 worth of shares.
to pay money regularly in order to have a newspaper or magazine sent to you, or to receive a broadcasting, telephone, or Internet service
Which Internet Service Provider do you subscribe to?
to ask or agree to buy shares in a company that has offered shares to investors
Each rights holder will be entitled to subscribe for one share of common stock.
to pay money regularly to be a member of an organization or to help its work
Chris subscribes to an environmental action group.
Please subscribe your name to the document.
